chat.common

Interface Action

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Algorithm, Algorithm

    public interface Action
    This interface defines the interface of the actions of the algorithms of the client or the server. An action has an identifier and is obtained with the method identifier. The identifiers are computed in the enumerations ListOfAlgorithms and ListOfAlgorithms. The second method (execute) is called for executing the action. The context of the call are the state of the entity (client or server) and the message that has just been received.
    Author:
    Denis Conan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean INTERCEPTION_ON
      states whether some non-determinism is introduced to test distributed algorithms.
      static int OFFSET_CLIENT_ALGORITHMS
      index of the first message type of the first algorithm of the client.
      static int OFFSET_SERVER_ALGORITHMS
      index of the first message type of the first algorithm of the server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(AbstractState state, AbstractContent msg)
      executes the algorithmic part corresponding to this action.
      default void executeOrIntercept(AbstractState state, AbstractContent msg)
      executes the action due to the receipt of the message msg or intercepts the call of the action for instance to eventually re-schedule the receipt of the message so that some non-determinism is introduced.
      int identifier()
      gets the identifier (integer) of the action, which can be attached to a message dispatcher.

    • Field Detail

      • OFFSET_SERVER_ALGORITHMS

        static final int OFFSET_SERVER_ALGORITHMS
        index of the first message type of the first algorithm of the server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OFFSET_CLIENT_ALGORITHMS

        static final int OFFSET_CLIENT_ALGORITHMS
        index of the first message type of the first algorithm of the client.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTERCEPTION_ON

        static final boolean INTERCEPTION_ON
        states whether some non-determinism is introduced to test distributed algorithms. This is done by rerouting in the default method executeOrIntercept(AbstractState, AbstractContent).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • identifier

        int identifier()
        gets the identifier (integer) of the action, which can be attached to a message dispatcher.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the action.

      • execute

        void execute(AbstractState state,
             AbstractContent msg)
        executes the algorithmic part corresponding to this action.
        Parameters:
        state - the state of the process.
        msg - the message in treatment.

      • executeOrIntercept

        default void executeOrIntercept(AbstractState state,
                                AbstractContent msg)
        executes the action due to the receipt of the message msg or intercepts the call of the action for instance to eventually re-schedule the receipt of the message so that some non-determinism is introduced. The behavior is controlled by the boolean value INTERCEPTION_ON.
        Parameters:
        state - the current state of the entity that receives the message.
        msg - the message to treat.
